thread.title: Ex PayPal exec gets 35 years for Vic rape
thread.title_full: Ex PayPal exec gets 35 years for Vic rape

title: Ex PayPal exec gets 35 years for Vic rape
text:
Share Ex PayPal exec gets 3.5 years for Vic rape - Yahoo7 A former PayPal executive who "had it all" has buried his face in tissues as a judge sentenced him for the second time to jail for raping a 20-year-old he met in a bar during a business trip. 
Mark Van Der Zant, 45, was found guilty and jailed for the 2013 crime in 2015, but a retrial was ordered after an appeal and he was released on bail. 
On Thursday, after the retrial, a Victorian County Court judge imposed the same sentence of five years and nine months with a non-parole period of three-and-a-half years that the first judge had handed down almost two years ago. 
Van Der Zant had been a man who "had it all" - a wife, two children, a successful career, a house - but he has lost it all since his "opportunistic" crime, judge Michael Tinney said. 
The successful businessman had denied wrongdoing throughout the four years since the incident, arguing the sex was consensual. 
How consent could have been obtained from a "comatose", "vulnerable" young woman who had been vomiting and could not walk was puzzling, the judge said. 
"You were using her for your own sexual release, that's obvious enough," he said. 
The young woman had been a part-time employee of the Hilton Hotel and was at a work function when she met Van Der Zant, who was on business from Sydney. 
She got so intoxicated she could not stand up, use her phone or give her address. 
So her two female work colleagues decided she'd have to stay at the hotel. 
Van Der Zant, two PayPal colleagues and the victim's colleagues retired to one of the men's rooms where she vomited. 
So they moved her to Van Der Zant's room where she slept on the floor while he and her 36-year-old manager had sex. 
At some point, the victim was moved to the bed and the older woman left the room, leaving Van Der Zant sleeping naked next to her vulnerable employee. 
The victim awoke to find her jeans around her ankles and Van Der Zant holding her down by her wrists. 
The woman said nothing during the ordeal, dressed and left the hotel, and immediately told a friend she'd been raped.
